question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed. 

You can find a list of Biden's interviews and their transcripts here.

question.title: Will Biden remain President through end of July 2024?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Biden remains US President through the end of July 2024 (ET); resolves NO if he resigns, dies, or otherwise ceases to be President before then.

Temporary transfer of power under the 25th amendement (i.e. making his VP the Acting President) does not cause a YES resolution. (Acting President is different from President under the Constitution)

question.title: Will at least 20 House/Senate Democrats sign a public letter opposing the plan to virtually nominate Biden early?
question.body:
Context from Politico:

Dozens of House Democrats are organizing a plan to speak out against their own party’s effort to seal President Joe Biden’s nomination sooner than originally planned, which they argue stifles the intense ongoing debate about his candidacy, according to a lawmaker involved in the effort.

A drafted letter, circulated by Rep. Jared Huffman (D-Calif.) and obtained by POLITICO, offers the first public signal from Democrats since the weekend’s attempted assassination on former President Donald Trump that scores of their own members remain deeply unsettled about the future of Biden’s candidacy.

“It’s a really bad move by the DNC. Somebody thinks it’s a clever way to lock down debate and I guess by dint of sheer force, achieve unity, but it doesn’t work that way,” Huffman said in an interview. He declined to confirm the existence of a letter.

This market resolves YES if a public letter opposing the early nomination plan is signed by at least 20 House Members or Senators who caucus with the Democratic Party before market close at the end of Sunday, July 21st. 

Multiple such letters with a combined total of 20 lawmaker's signatures would also be sufficient to resolve this market to YES. 

If these criteria are not met by market close, this market resolves NO.

question.title: Will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invokes Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time).

The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

This question will resolve as **Yes** if before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a [warrant of arrest](https://www.icc-cpi.int/about/how-the-court-works) for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members. It will resolve as **No** otherwise.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a public statement regarding the investigation of any of the listed Israeli leaders before June 30, 2024. It will resolve as No otherwise.

P_given_Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a public statement regarding the investigation of any of the listed Israeli leaders before June 30, 2024. It will resolve as No otherwise. Furthermore, this question will resolve as Yes if before July 1, 2024, the ICC issues a warrant of arrest for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members:

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

It will resolve as No otherwise.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that the International Criminal Court does not issue a statement regarding the investigation of Israeli leaders before June 30, 2024, will the International Criminal Court issue arrest warrants for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024?
P_given_not_Q.body:
This question will resolve as Yes if the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024. It will resolve as No otherwise.

Condition P: The ICC does not issue a public statement regarding the investigation of any of the listed Israeli leaders before June 30, 2024.
Resolution criteria for Q: The ICC issues a warrant of arrest for any of the below listed Israeli cabinet members before July 1, 2024.

* Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister)
* Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister)
* Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff)

question.title: Given the ICC issues arrest warrants for Israeli leaders, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi. Then, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if the ICC issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President before August 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking Section 3 of the 25th Amendment does not count.

Q.title: Will Biden's approval rating drop below 40% before August 2024 if the ICC issues arrest warrants for Israeli leaders?
Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if Biden's approval rating, as measured by a reputable polling organization, falls below 40% before August 2024 following the issuance of ICC arrest warrants for Israeli leaders. It will resolve as No if his approval rating remains at or above 40% during that time.

P_given_Q.title: Given the ICC issues arrest warrants for Israeli leaders, will Biden's approval rating drop below 40% before August 2024 and will he be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment?
P_given_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: The International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi, before July 1, 2024. Then, will Biden's approval rating, as measured by a reputable polling organization, fall below 40% before August 2024? Additionally, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if the ICC issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Biden's approval rating falls below 40% before August 2024 and if the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President before August 2024. Resolves NO otherwise.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given the ICC issues arrest warrants for Israeli leaders, will Biden's approval rating remain at or above 40% before August 2024 and will he be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question combines two conditions. First, it assumes that the International Criminal Court (ICC) issues a warrant of arrest for any of the listed Israeli leaders: Benjamin Netanyahu, Yoav Gallant, or Herzi Halevi, before July 1, 2024. This condition resolves YES if the ICC issues a warrant and NO otherwise. Second, it asks whether Biden's approval rating, as measured by a reputable polling organization, remains at or above 40% before August 2024 following the issuance of ICC arrest warrants for Israeli leaders. This resolves YES if his approval rating remains at or above 40% and NO if it falls below 40%. Finally, it also asks whether the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President before August 2024. This resolves YES if that occurs and NO otherwise.

question.title: If the ICC does not issue arrest warrants for listed Israeli leaders before July 1, 2024, will Biden be declared incapacitated under the 25th Amendment Section 4 before August 2024?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). Given this, will the Vice President and a majority of the Cabinet (or other relevant body) invoke Section 4 of the 25th Amendment to formally declare that "the President is unable to discharge the powers and duties of his office" and cause the Vice President to serve as Acting President, before August 2024 (Eastern time)?

Note: The duration of the incapacity does not matter for this question. Biden exiting the office of the Presidency by death, resignation, etc., does not count. Biden invoking section 3 of the 25th amendment does not count.

P_given_not_Q.body: This question will resolve as Yes if there is no significant political event that influences U.S. foreign policy before August 2024, and before July 1, 2024, the International Criminal Court (ICC) does not issue a warrant of arrest for any of the following Israeli cabinet members: Benjamin Netanyahu (Prime Minister), Yoav Gallant (Defense Minister), Herzi Halevi (IDF Chief of Staff). question.title: Will the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
question.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the [movie's page](https://www.boxofficemojo.com/title/tt6263850/?ref_=bo_se_r_1) is higher than $185,548,391 which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752.

Q.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page exceeds $200 million.

P_given_Q.body:

Additionally, this question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. Therefore, the resolution criteria are: 
1. The domestic box office opening of **Deadpool & Wolverine** exceeds $200 million. 
2. The domestic box office opening of **Deadpool & Wolverine** is higher than $185,548,391.

P_given_not_Q.title: Given that the domestic box office opening of "Deadpool & Wolverine" does not exceed $200 million, will it be higher than that of "Deadpool" and "The Wolverine" combined?
P_given_not_Q.body: This question resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for the **Deadpool & Wolverine** reported by Boxofficemojo on the movie's page is higher than $185,548,391, which is the sum of the box openings for **Deadpool** (2016) and **The Wolverine** (2013): $132,434,639 + $53,113,752. The condition resolves as **Yes** if the domestic box office opening for **Deadpool & Wolverine** does not exceed $200 million.

question.title: Will Joe Biden announce that he is both dropping out and resigning from the presidency before the end of July?
question.body:
Resolves YES if Joe Biden announces both that he is no longer running for re-election and that he will be resigning and not completing his current term. These announcements before the end of July 2024 in Pacific Time, but he does not have to have formally resigned and be out of office before the end of July. An announcement of his intention to do so is sufficient to resolve this market.

Otherwise, this market resolves NO on August 1st.

question.title: Will Joe Biden have an in-person interview/conversation on camera for 45+ minutes, before the end of July 2024?
question.body:
The most recent qualifying interview was Biden's appearance on The Howard Stern Show in April, when Biden answered questions for ~70 minutes. 

If Biden appears in another such in-person interview for at least 45 minutes, this market resolves YES. If no qualifying interview is released before market close at the end of July, this market resolves NO. 

This market does not include press conferences, speeches, rallies, fundraisers, town halls, etc. It can include appearances on a podcast or late night show, or an interview edited into a show like 60 minutes. However, there must be at least 45 minutes of new footage of Biden being interviewed in-person for such appearances to count. A 50 minute video might only feature 20 minutes of video of Biden being interviewed, and so would not count.

For context, Biden's interview with Stephanopoulos in July, his appearance on Jimmy Fallon in February, and his past appearances on 60 minutes have each had less than 30 minutes of video footage of Biden being interviewed.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.
